title: Police investigating burglary at Nelson's Jens Hansen Jewellers
text:
Police investigating burglary at Nelson's Jens Hansen Jewellers SAMANTHA GEE Last updated 12:48, February 17 2017 Martin de Ruyter 
Halfdan Hansen of Jens Hansen Jewellers, who designed the rings for The Hobbit and Lord of the Rings movies, has been targeted by thieves in Nelson. 
Police are appealing for information after jewellery was stolen from Jens Hansen Jewellers in Nelson in the early hours of Friday morning. 
A police spokeswoman said at approximately 2.35am an offender used a rock to gain entry to the Jens Hansen Jewellers on the corner of Trafalgar Square and Selwyn Place, causing extensive damage to the store. 
The rock was then used to smash open the glass cabinets inside the shop and several pieces of jewellery were taken. 
Jens Hansen director Halfdan Hansen, who designed the rings for Peter Jackson's Lord of the Rings and Hobbit movies, said after initial observations this morning there appeared to have been little taken. However, there had been significant damage to the glass display cases in an attempt to access the jewellery. 
It was not yet known what amount of jewellery had been taken. 
Hansen said the store would be closed on Friday while staff cleaned up the damage and assisted with police investigations. 

Police would like to hear from anyone who was in the Nelson Central area around the time of the burglary, as they may have information that could assist with their investigation. 
Any information can be provided to Nelson Police on (03) 546 3840. Alternatively, information can also be reported anonymously via Crimestoppers on 08000 555 111.
